text: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
author: Thoma Edison

text: It's not that I'm so smart, it's just that I stay with problems longer.
author: Albert Einstein

text: True genius sees with the eyes of a child and thinks with the brain of a genie.
author: Puzant Kevork Thomajan

text: Genius without education is like silver in the mine.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: A man of genius makes no mistakes; his errors are volitional and are the portals of discovery.
author: James Joyce

text: Genius must be born, and never can be taught.
author: John Dryden

text: There's a fine line between genius and insanity, as we all know.
author: Mackenzie Phillips

text: Talent hits a target no one else can hit; Genius hits a target no one else can see.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: Geniuses are people who notice things and connections between things which others haven't noticed. Genius must be a surprise.
author: Christopher Ricks

text: Men of genius are not quick judges of character.
author: Max Beerbohm

text: Genius is making complex ideas simple, not making simple ideas complex.
author: Albert Einstein

text: A true genius admits that he/she knows nothing.
author: Albert Einstein
